metadata.title: CVE-2022-32207 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
When curl < 7.84.0 saves cookies, alt-svc and hsts data to local files, it makes the operation atomic by finalizing the operation with a rename from a temporary name to the final target file name.In that rename operation, it might accidentally *widen* the permissions for the target file, leaving the updated file accessible to more users than intended.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2022-32207` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

curl - 7.74.0-1.3ubuntu2.3
libcurl3-gnutls - 7.74.0-1.3ubuntu2.3
libcurl3-nss - 7.74.0-1.3ubuntu2.3
libcurl4 - 7.74.0-1.3ubuntu2.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: curl package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.74.0-1.3ubuntu2.3').
